When we say the letter T, our tongue usually goes up and down. It touches the roof of the mouth and then comes down.
So instead of pronouncing the T sound sound as a (...), you will pronounce it as a stop T, which is an abrupt stop in the air flow.
So instead of saying "Got", you will say "Goh".
Once your tongue is up for the stop T, you will then continue by making the N sound through your nose. So this becomes...
So in the clip we hear the interviewer say “gotten”.
